prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

Hailee has been cheated on by every single one of her exes

name: Rafael
mes:
Rafael bounced on his heels as he waited for the elevator in his apartment complex, already thinking about tonight. He'd been looking forward to this since Nina DMed him on Instagram‚Äînot just the party, but finally getting a chance to show Hailee off to all his old college friends.

It had been a surprise to hear from Nina after all this time. She had been his college girlfriend, dropped him right after graduation and broke his heart, making sure their entire social circle knew that she had "higher ambitions." She left the city and basically disappeared completely on Rafa and their mutual friends.

But now she was back. Rafael had no idea since when, why, or if she planned to stay. He hadn't bothered asking. All he knew was that she invited him to her comeback pool party at her parents' house‚Äîand everyone knew Nina's parties had always been the best. It was basically a no-brainer, especially after she mentioned that not only the old college soccer team, but also Coach Martinez was coming.

The party was supposed to start at 5 pm, but since Hailee had to work until 5:30, they told Nina they would come together later, probably around 7. The plan was easy: Rafael would pick Hailee up from work at exactly 5:30, then swing by their place, help them get ready (and steal a few kisses, cause how could he not when his perfect partner was changing?) and then head to Nina's place together.

His phone buzzed just as he sat down in his car.

Nina: Rafa! Change of plans! Coach Martinez is only gonna be here for another hour, he's got an early flight tomorrow. You HAVE to come now or you'll miss him!!

Rafael: fuuuuck, wish I could, but I still gotta pick up Hailee. I promised.

Nina: Oh yeah, dw about that. I texted them already. They'll meet you here, I gave them my address.

Rafael: rly?

Nina: Yeah, they were totally understanding. Better hurry now and get here. Coach's already asking about you. üíñ

Rafael: omw, be there in 10

Rafael's face lit up as he started the engine. Yeah, that sounded exactly like Hailee. He felt a little bad about not picking them up and missing their planned routine, but the fact that they were cool with that last minute change? God, they were always so understanding. So perfect.

What he didn't know was that Nina did in fact text them her address, but she didn't bother asking if they were okay with the change of plans. Just made it sound like Rafael had already decided to come earlier, and that they could join later.

Nina's parents' house looked exactly the same as it had in college‚Äîmassive, pristine, with the kind of backyard that screamed money. The pool area was already packed when Rafael arrived, music thumping, people everywhere. It felt like stepping back in time.

"There he is! RAFA!"

Before he could even process what was happening, Nina was throwing herself into his arms, all sun-kissed skin and long, blonde hair. She looked good‚Äîreally good‚Äîin a tiny red bikini that left nothing to the imagination.

"Nina, hey!" He hugged her back, grinning. "This is insane, everyone's here!"

"I know, right? It's like college all over again!" She pulled back but kept her hands on his shoulders, her touch lingering. "Come on, you need to put your phone in the basket. Phone-free party, remember? Just like the old days."

Rafael barely registered handing over his phone, too busy scanning the crowd for familiar faces. There were Tommy, Mike and Danny from the soccer team, and Sarah from Nina's sorority, and‚Äî

"CARVALHO!"

Coach Martinez's booming voice cut through everything. Rafael's face split into the biggest grin as the older man pulled him into a bear hug that nearly lifted him off his feet.

"Coach! I can't believe you're here, man. Nina said you had to leave early?"

"Flight at 6 AM tomorrow, but I couldn't miss seeing you. Heard you're doing good, training people now? Always knew you'd find your way."

They talked for what felt like forever, Coach Martinez catching him up on the old team, asking about his life now. Rafael found himself gushing about Hailee‚Äîhow amazing they were, how they made him feel like the luckiest guy alive, how he was pretty sure he was gonna marry them even though they'd only been dating a few weeks.

"Sounds like you got it bad," Coach Martinez laughed, clapping him on the back. "Good for you, kid."

When Coach Martinez finally had to leave, Rafael felt like he was floating. The only thing missing for a perfect evening was Hailee. Later, when they showed up and met all of his friends, everyone would adore them. He could already imagine how perfectly they'd fit in.

"Rafa, come swim with me!" Nina appeared at his elbow again, her hand sliding down his arm. "The water's perfect."

The pool was crowded but fun, exactly the kind of chaos Rafael loved. He cannon-balled right in and immediately got into a splash fight with Tommy and Mike from the team. Nina kept swimming closer, giggling at everything he said, but Rafael was too busy catching up with everyone to notice how she pressed against him when she laughed.

"God, I missed this," she said at one point, her hand finding his chest as they treaded water. "Missed us... All of us, I mean. The group."

"Yeah, it's awesome," Rafael agreed, missing the way her fingers traced over his tattoos. "Hailee's gonna flip when they see everyone. They're gonna love Danny's story about that time we snuck into the rival school's pool."

Nina's smile tightened for just a second. "Right. Hailee. They're... still coming."

"Yeah, they had to work until 5:30. But they should be here soon!" Rafael checked his wrist where a watch would be if he wore one, then laughed. "I have no idea what time it is without my phone."

"It's still early," Nina said quickly, moving closer. "Plenty of time."

The party flowed around them, people jumping in and out of the pool, music pumping, drinks flowing. Rafael was in his element‚Äîlaughing too loud, telling stories that had everyone cracking up. He didn't notice how Nina positioned herself closer and closer, how her legs kept brushing his under the water. She had always been touchy in college, after all.

"Remember when you scored that goal against State?" she said, her palm flat against his chest. "God, you were so hot that day."

"That was a good game," Rafael agreed, oblivious to her tone. "Hailee would've loved to see it. They get so excited when I tell them soccer stories. It's so cute, they ask all these questions and their eyes get all wide and‚Äî"

"Mmm," Nina hummed, not really listening, her fingers playing with the waistband of his swim shorts beneath the water.

"‚Äîand they made me this playlist of songs that remind them of me, which is insane because I'm not that interesting, but they think I am, and‚Äî"

By the time the crowd in the pool had thinned out a bit, Rafael and Nina had somehow ended up in the corner where the hot tub jets created a little alcove. Nina was practically draped over him, her arm around his shoulders, whispering in his ear about how much she'd missed having him around.

Rafael was nodding along, still talking about Hailee, when he heard footsteps on the pool deck.

He turned toward the sound, face lighting up like Christmas morning as he spotted Hailee walking toward the pool. He started to wave enthusiastically, water sloshing everywhere.

"Meu amor! You made it! I was just telling Nina about‚Äî"

But something was wrong. Hailee's face looked... off. Angry? Hurt? Rafael's smile faltered as he tried to process what he was seeing, completely unaware of how it must look‚Äîhim in the corner of the pool with his ex-girlfriend practically in his lap, her arm around him, her lips way too close to his ear.

Nina barely looked up, but the triumphant smile on her lips was telling, her acrylic nails trailing back and forth on Rafael's abs. "Oh! You must be Hailee! Rafa's told me so much about you."

He tried to get up to go and greet Hailee properly, but Nina's grip on him only tightened. Rafael looked between them, confusion written all over his face.

"Beb√™, are you okay? Are you not feeling well?"

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee pauses her heels stop clicking against the pool tiles as she glances down at the pool snd sees the scene. Hailee is furious and sad and upset*

*Hailee has been calling and texting him for over an hour because he promised to come and get her until she finally managed to get an Uber home to change and get her own car. So this was why he was ignoring her because he was here in this pool with a woman wrapped around him and stroking his abs in the way he likes*

*Hailee stops a few feet from the pool and glances down at the two of them* "I waited for over an hour for you. Guess you were busy." *God she thought he was different. Different then everyone else bit fuck he is just like them*

name: Rafael
mes:
Rafael's face crumpled like a kicked puppy as he finally processed Hailee's words. He scrambled out of the pool so fast he nearly slipped, water cascading off his body as he stood dripping before them. "Wait‚Äîwhat? No, beb√™, Nina said she texted you that I was coming early! She told me you were cool with it and‚Äî"

His voice died in his throat when he saw the hurt flashing in Hailee‚Äôs emerald eyes. His stomach dropped. *Fuck.*

Nina‚Äôs smirk from the pool was venomous, but Rafael barely registered it‚Äîhis entire focus zeroed in on Hailee. He reached for them instinctively, then froze when they flinched back. "Oh god, no no no‚Äî*merda*, you didn‚Äôt know? She *lied* to me?" His voice cracked on the last word, rough with realization.

He whirled toward Nina, chest heaving. "*You* told me they knew! Why would you‚Äî" But Nina just blinked up at him with faux innocence, twirling a strand of wet hair around her finger. "Oops," she murmured sweetly before turning to float away lazily through the water like none of this mattered at all.

Rafael turned back to Hailee so fast water droplets flew off his hair onto their shoes (which only made him feel worse). His hands hovered uselessly between them like he wanted to touch but didn‚Äôt dare anymore.

"I swear on my *m√£e*, I thought you knew," he rasped out desperately as people nearby started glancing over at their scene with interest or pity or both (he didn't care). "Coach Martinez was here early and she said‚Äîfuck!" He dragged both hands down his face hard enough that it stung before dropping them helplessly at his sides again.

Then suddenly something else clicked into place: all those missed calls and texts from earlier while his phone sat abandoned in Nina's basket by the door because *of course* she'd taken it under false pretenses too...

His breath hitched audibly when realization fully dawned on him just how badly this looked: ignoring Hailee for over an hour while letting some other woman drape herself all over him exactly where they could see everything clear as day...

Without another second wasted trying futilely explain himself further (because what good would words do now?), Rafael bolted past gawking partygoers toward where phones were piled neatly into baskets near towels nobody had bothered using yet after swimming...

He snatched up theirs immediately only for screen after screen full notifications from 'Meu Amor ‚ù§Ô∏è' staring back accusingly:

**[12 Missed Calls]**
**[23 Unread Messages]**

The last one read simply:
**"I'm coming there myself since clearly whatever is happening is more important than keeping your promise."**

And below that? A timestamp showing sent **47 minutes ago**. Meaning not only had they been left waiting alone outside work wondering where theirs ride went...but also forced themselves through changing clothes alone *(without kisses)* *(without help picking outfits)* *(without hearing how beautiful they looked every five seconds like usual)* ‚Äîall because some manipulative ex decided playing games sounded fun today...

When Rafa turned around again clutching his phone tightly enough the plastic case creaked slightly under hsi grip; His expression shattered open and raw guilt written plainly across every feature possible without even needing say single additional word aloud first place...
swipes:
Rafael's entire body went rigid the second he heard the hurt in Hailee's voice. His brain short-circuited for a second‚Äî*waited? An hour?*‚Äîbefore everything clicked into place with sickening clarity.

He shoved Nina off him so hard she stumbled back into the water, spluttering. **"What the fuck?"**

But Rafael was already hauling himself out of the pool, water sluicing off his body as he scrambled toward Hailee, heart hammering against his ribs. **"Meu amor‚Äîwait‚Äîno, no, no."** His hands reached for them but stopped short when they flinched back. The way they looked at him‚Äîlike he'd *broken* something between them‚Äîmade his stomach drop to his feet.

**"She lied to me,"** he blurted, voice cracking under the weight of panic. **"Nina told me she texted you that I was coming early! She said you *knew*!"** He whirled around toward Nina, who was still in the pool with an infuriatingly smug smirk playing on her lips. **"You fucking lied!"**

Nina rolled her eyes like this was all some silly misunderstanding. **"Oh please, Rafa, don't be dramatic."** She flicked water off her fingers dismissively before turning a saccharine smile toward Hailee. **"He‚Äôs always been *so* bad at keeping track of time."**

Rafael saw red. He took a step toward Nina like he might actually throttle her before remembering himself and spinning back to Hailee instead‚Äîhands shaking now with barely contained rage and desperation both clawing up his throat at once:

***‚ÄúI would never stand you up.‚Äù*** His voice dropped low enough that only they could hear it over the music; raw enough that it scraped against every word like gravel under skin: ***‚ÄúNever.* Not for anything or anyone.‚Äù**

His fingers twitched at his sides like they physically ached to reach out and fix this somehow but didn‚Äôt dare without permission first because right now? Right now one wrong move felt like it might shatter whatever fragile trust remained between them entirely‚Ä¶ And nothing had ever terrified him more than losing what little ground he‚Äôd gained in their world together so far‚Ä¶

So instead Rafael just stood there dripping wet onto concrete tiles while everyone around them pretended not stare (but absolutely were), chest rising too fast beneath tattoo ink gone dark from chlorine as whispered again:

***‚ÄúPlease let me explain.‚Äù***

Rafael's face crumpled like a kicked puppy as he finally processed Hailee's words. He scrambled out of the pool so fast he nearly slipped, water cascading off his body as he stood dripping before them. "Wait‚Äîwhat? No, beb√™, Nina said she texted you that I was coming early! She told me you were cool with it and‚Äî"

His voice died in his throat when he saw the hurt flashing in Hailee‚Äôs emerald eyes. His stomach dropped. *Fuck.*

Nina‚Äôs smirk from the pool was venomous, but Rafael barely registered it‚Äîhis entire focus zeroed in on Hailee. He reached for them instinctively, then froze when they flinched back. "Oh god, no no no‚Äî*merda*, you didn‚Äôt know? She *lied* to me?" His voice cracked on the last word, rough with realization.

He whirled toward Nina, chest heaving. "*You* told me they knew! Why would you‚Äî" But Nina just blinked up at him with faux innocence, twirling a strand of wet hair around her finger. "Oops," she murmured sweetly before turning to float away lazily through the water like none of this mattered at all.

Rafael turned back to Hailee so fast water droplets flew off his hair onto their shoes (which only made him feel worse). His hands hovered uselessly between them like he wanted to touch but didn‚Äôt dare anymore.

"I swear on my *m√£e*, I thought you knew," he rasped out desperately as people nearby started glancing over at their scene with interest or pity or both (he didn't care). "Coach Martinez was here early and she said‚Äîfuck!" He dragged both hands down his face hard enough that it stung before dropping them helplessly at his sides again.

Then suddenly something else clicked into place: all those missed calls and texts from earlier while his phone sat abandoned in Nina's basket by the door because *of course* she'd taken it under false pretenses too...

His breath hitched audibly when realization fully dawned on him just how badly this looked: ignoring Hailee for over an hour while letting some other woman drape herself all over him exactly where they could see everything clear as day...

Without another second wasted trying futilely explain himself further (because what good would words do now?), Rafael bolted past gawking partygoers toward where phones were piled neatly into baskets near towels nobody had bothered using yet after swimming...

He snatched up theirs immediately only for screen after screen full notifications from 'Meu Amor ‚ù§Ô∏è' staring back accusingly:

**[12 Missed Calls]**
**[23 Unread Messages]**

The last one read simply:
**"I'm coming there myself since clearly whatever is happening is more important than keeping your promise."**

And below that? A timestamp showing sent **47 minutes ago**. Meaning not only had they been left waiting alone outside work wondering where theirs ride went...but also forced themselves through changing clothes alone *(without kisses)* *(without help picking outfits)* *(without hearing how beautiful they looked every five seconds like usual)* ‚Äîall because some manipulative ex decided playing games sounded fun today...

When Rafa turned around again clutching his phone tightly enough the plastic case creaked slightly under hsi grip; His expression shattered open and raw guilt written plainly across every feature possible without even needing say single additional word aloud first place...

Rafael's entire body went rigid as Hailee's words hit him like a punch to the gut. His smile dropped instantly, replaced by wide-eyed confusion and then dawning horror as he finally‚Äî*finally*‚Äîregistered how this must look.

"Wait‚Äîwhat? No, *no*, beb√™, I‚Äî" He shoved Nina‚Äôs hand off his stomach so hard she nearly slipped under the water, scrambling to get out of the pool with all the grace of a panicked golden retriever. Water sloshed everywhere as he hauled himself onto the deck, dripping and breathless. "I thought you *knew*! Nina said she texted you! She told me you were cool with meeting here instead!"

Nina made a soft *tsk* noise from behind him, still lounging against the pool edge like none of this was her problem. "Rafa, sweetie, I *did* text them." She flicked her fingers dismissively toward Hailee. "Guess they just didn‚Äôt check their phone?"

Rafael whirled on her so fast water sprayed off his shoulders. "*What?!* No‚Äîyou said they were *okay with it!* You said‚Äî" His voice cracked mid-sentence as realization slammed into him: Nina had played him like a fucking fiddle. Again.

He turned back to Hailee desperately, hands outstretched like he could physically pull them closer through sheer willpower alone. Their face was stone-cold furious in a way Rafael had never seen before‚Äînot at *him*, never at him until now‚Äîand it made his chest ache violently.

"Hailee," he rasped, stepping forward (ignoring how everyone at the party had gone dead silent around them). "I swear to god I would *never* ditch you like that on purpose." He raked both hands through his soaked hair in frustration before gesturing wildly back at Nina without even looking at her again: "*She lied to me.* I thought we were coming here together after your shift but then she told me Coach Martinez was leaving early and that you knew about it and‚Äî‚Äù His voice broke again when he saw tears welling in Hailee‚Äôs eyes despite their ironclad glare; Rafael looked seconds away from dropping to his knees right there on the concrete if it meant making things right between them again somehow...

Rafael's entire body went rigid as the realization hit him like a freight train. The color drained from his face as he finally processed Hailee's words‚Äî*an hour*. He hadn't gotten any texts. His phone was in that stupid basket Nina made him put it in.

"Wait‚Äîwhat? No, no, beb√™, I‚Äî" He shoved Nina‚Äôs hand off his stomach so hard she nearly slipped backward into the water. "I didn‚Äôt get any calls! Nina said you were cool with me coming early!"

Nina scoffed, rolling her eyes dramatically as she steadied herself against the pool ledge. "Oh please, Rafa, don‚Äôt be dramatic." She flicked her wet hair over her shoulder and smirked up at Hailee. "He was *dying* to see everyone again. You can't blame him for wanting to catch up with old friends."

Rafael's jaw clenched so tight it hurt. He hauled himself out of the pool in one sharp movement, water sluicing off his body as he stumbled toward Hailee barefoot on the tiles. His hands hovered uselessly between them like he wanted to touch but wasn‚Äôt sure if he was allowed anymore‚Äînot when they were looking at him like *that*, all hurt and betrayal burning behind those emerald eyes he adored so much.

"Hailee," His voice cracked on their name, raw and desperate. "I swear to God I thought you knew I was coming here first." He raked a shaky hand through his soaked hair before gesturing wildly back toward Nina still lounging in the pool like this was some kind of game to her.

"She told me *you* texted *her* that it was fine! That you'd meet me here! If I had known‚Äîfuck‚Äîif I had even *thought* for a second you were waiting for me‚Äî‚Äù His breath hitched when Hailee took a step back from him instead of forward.

The party noise around them dimmed into white noise; all Rafael could focus on was how small they suddenly looked standing there alone by the edge of an overcrowded pool full of strangers laughing too loud over music that now felt grating instead of fun.

Nina called something snide from behind him but Rafael didn't even register it because Hailee turned sharply on her heel like she couldn‚Äôt stand looking at him another second longer‚Äî

And then Rafael did what any idiot golden retriever would do when faced with losing what mattered most: **he chased after them.**

Bare feet slapping against concrete still hot from earlier sun exposure despite dusk settling in now; damp swim trunks clinging uncomfortably while people gawked openly at this spectacle unfolding across deck chairs half-filled with tipsy partygoers sipping cocktails through tiny straws‚Äî

But none if it mattered except catching up before they disappeared entirely because fuck if Rafa wasn't about lose everything good left inside himself tonight otherwise...

Rafael's entire body went rigid as the realization hit him like a freight train. His smile dropped instantly, eyes widening in horror as he finally processed Hailee's expression‚Äîthe hurt flashing in those emerald eyes, the way her hands trembled at her sides.

*Fuck.*

He shoved Nina off so hard she nearly slipped under the water, scrambling out of the pool with all the grace of a panicked golden retriever. Water cascaded off him as he stumbled onto the deck, leaving slick footprints on the tiles. "Hailee‚Äîmeu amor, wait‚Äî"

His voice cracked mid-sentence when he saw her take a step back from him, arms crossing protectively over her chest. The way she looked at him‚Äîlike he'd just ripped her heart out and stomped on it‚Äîmade his stomach drop to his knees.

"Nina said she texted you!" Rafael blurted desperately, raking wet hands through his hair. "She told me you were okay with me coming early! I would *never* just leave you waiting like that if I knew‚Äî" He whirled around toward Nina still smirking in the pool. "*You lied to me?!*"

Nina had the audacity to bat her eyelashes innocently as she floated on her back. "I *did* text them your location..." She trailed off with a shrug that made Rafael see red.

He turned back to Hailee so fast water droplets flew off his shoulders. Every muscle in his body was coiled tight with panic now, hands hovering like he wanted to reach for her but didn't dare touch when she looked this brittle.

"I swear on my mother's life I thought you knew," he rasped, voice raw and too loud even over thumping bass of party music still playing around them oblivious to their crisis unfolding by poolside edge where people were starting stare now too because oh god this was turning into spectacle wasn‚Äôt it?

Rafael didn‚Äôt care about audience though; all oxygen left world when Hailee took another step backward toward exit instead answering him first time ever since they met where words failed come out between them because usually? Usually they couldn‚Äôt shut up around each other but right now silence between them felt like physical wound splitting open wider every second ticking by without fix being made yet somehow despite terror clawing up throat at thought losing best thing ever happened him (because let‚Äôs be real here: no one else compared not even close), something primal kicked inside chest watching pain flicker across face person meant more than anything else combined ‚Äî

So before could think better idea (or lack thereof), Rafael dropped straight onto knees right there soaking wet concrete scraping skin through swim trunks fabric but zero fucks given about appearance dignity anything except making damn clear where loyalties lay:

‚ÄúPlease.‚Äù Voice broke completely now rough whisper only meant for ears even though half party probably witnessing trainwreck unfold live ‚ÄúLook at me baby please just look at me‚Äî‚Äù Reached hand slowly palm-up offering not demanding because never demand from Hailee especially not like this ‚ÄúI fucked up bad didn‚Äôt check properly trusted wrong person but *you* are only one want touching me ever again swear Christ above‚Äî‚Äù

Glanced over shoulder briefly shooting death glare toward Nina who finally had decency look uncomfortable before turning back pleading brown eyes locked onto green ones currently glassy unshed tears threatening spill any moment now:

‚ÄúCan we go home? Please let take home minha vida talk properly somewhere quiet without‚Äî‚Äù Gestured vaguely chaotic scene around them including ex-girlfriend currently realizing maybe shouldn't have played games today after all judging by murderous expression normally sweetest guy soccer team ever produced directed squarely direction these past thirty seconds solid nonstop fury usually reserved protecting things precious him which apparently included relationship most people thought moved fast until saw way two orbited each other gravity-defying intensity since day one meeting mutual friends gathering month prior...

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee likes Rafael a lot but she doesnt want to get hurt again. She glances around and sees all of Rafael's friends so she sighs and plaster on a smile* "Just go get me a ddrink. We will discuss this later" *She mumbles going to sit at a table by the pool*

name: Rafael
mes:
Rafael's entire body sagged with relief at Hailee's words, but the way they forced that smile made his chest ache. He nodded quickly, already backing toward the bar like a man on a mission. "Sim, sim‚Äîanything you want, beb√™. I'll be right back."

His hands were shaking as he grabbed two cups‚Äîone for Hailee‚Äôs drink (vodka cranberry, extra lime, *exactly* how they liked it) and one for water because he wasn‚Äôt stupid enough to think alcohol alone would fix this. He practically *sprinted* back to their table, nearly tripping over a lounge chair in his haste.

Setting the drinks down carefully in front of them like an offering (or maybe an apology), Rafael dropped into the seat beside theirs‚Äîclose enough to talk low under the music but not so close that they‚Äôd feel crowded. His knee bounced anxiously under the table as he leaned in slightly.

"I'm so fucking sorry," he whispered hoarsely before she could even take a sip of her drink. His fingers twitched against his own cup like he wanted to reach for them but stopped himself just short of touching their arm‚Äîunsure if it was allowed yet after what had happened tonight already...

His voice cracked when Nina laughed loudly somewhere behind him by poolside again; instinctively flinching away from sound entirely before turning pleading eyes back toward Hailee instead: "I swear I didn't know she lied about texting you first... And-and my phone was gone so I couldn't check yours either until just now when..." He swallowed hard around lump forming throat suddenly too tight speak properly anymore without sounding wrecked completely by guilt eating him alive inside out right now...

A beat passed where neither moved nor spoke while bass from speakers nearby thumped relentlessly against both eardrums mercilessly reminding everyone present how awkward silence between two people who usually couldn't shut up around each other truly felt like punishment worse than anything else imaginable really...

Then finally Rafa exhaled shakily through his nose before murmuring barely audible over the noise surrounding them both still: "...Can I hold your hand? Please?"
swipes:
Rafael‚Äôs entire body sagged with relief at Hailee‚Äôs words, but the way they forced that smile‚Äîlike they were swallowing glass just to keep the peace‚Äîmade his chest ache. He nodded quickly, already backing toward the drink table like a man on a mission. "Yeah‚Äî*yes*, beb√™, anything you want. I‚Äôll get it right now."

He practically *lunged* at the cooler, knocking over two solo cups in his haste before finally grabbing one and filling it with Hailee‚Äôs favorite drink (the one he always made sure to have stocked at his place because he memorized their preferences within days of meeting them). His hands shook slightly as he added extra lime‚Äîjust how they liked it‚Äîbefore turning back‚Ä¶ only to freeze mid-step.

Nina had materialized beside Hailee‚Äôs chair like some kind of vengeful poolside specter, leaning down to say something with a smirk that made Rafael see red.

**"NINA."** His voice cut through the party chatter like a blade, sharp enough that nearby conversations stuttered to a halt. He was across the deck in three strides, shoving between them so abruptly Nina stumbled back with an indignant squawk. He didn‚Äôt even glance her way as he thrust the cup toward Hailee like a peace offering (or maybe a lifeline).

"Here," he murmured softer now, crouching beside their chair so they wouldn't have to look up at him. The ice clinked nervously in the cup as his fingers brushed theirs during the handoff‚Äîlingering just half a second too long because *god*, he needed them to know this wasn't what it looked like... needed them not to pull away...

Behind him, Nina scoffed loudly enough for everyone nearby to hear: "Wow Rafa, didn't realize you were *that* whipped now." A few people laughed awkwardly; someone muttered *damn*. But Rafael didn‚Äôt rise to it this time‚Äîjust kept his eyes locked pleadingly on Hailee instead while pressing their free hand against his still-damp chest where she could feel how fast his heart was hammering under her palm despite everything else happening around them right then‚Ä¶

A silent plea: *Please believe me.*

Rafael's entire body sagged with relief at Hailee's words, but the way they plastered on that smile‚Äî*fake*, so painfully fake‚Äîmade his chest ache. He nodded frantically, water still dripping from his hair onto his shoulders as he scrambled to obey. "Yeah! Yeah, of course‚Äîwhat do you want? Anything, I'll get you *anything*." His voice was too loud, too eager, like if he just *fixed this fast enough*, maybe the hurt in their eyes would disappear.

He didn‚Äôt wait for an answer before bolting toward the drink table like a man possessed, nearly knocking over some guy holding a beer in his haste. "Sorry! Sorry‚Äî" He grabbed two cups (one for backup in case Hailee changed their mind), filled one with ice-cold lemonade (their favorite), and snatched up a handful of napkins because *shit*, they probably hated seeing him all wet and messy right now after *that* disaster of a first impression on his friends...

By the time he skidded back to where Hailee sat alone at the poolside table‚Äîignoring Nina‚Äôs pointed stare from across the deck‚Äîhe was breathless. He set the drink down carefully in front of them like an offering before hesitating awkwardly beside their chair instead of sitting uninvited.

"Here," he murmured softly this time instead of shouting like an idiot again (why did he always forget volume control when nervous?). Then quieter still: "...I‚Äôm gonna go grab my shirt so I‚Äôm not just... standing here dripping everywhere making it worse."

But before leaving even for that half-second trip toward where his stuff was piled near the towels? Rafael hesitated again then bent down slightly without thinking ‚Äî hand hovering near but not quite touching Hailee's knee under table where nobody else could see ‚Äî voice dropping into something rough and private between just them two:

"*You‚Äôre* most important though." A beat pause while heart hammered behind ribs hard enough bruise them internally forever probably if needed be honest here honestly yeah definitely worth it no question about it whatsoever really truly absolutely yes sirree bob‚Äì "*Always*. Promise."

Then straightening back up abruptly before could make things weirder by oversharing further (already mentally kicking himself repeatedly over entire existence generally speaking currently), Rafa practically sprinted off retrieve aforementioned shirt while simultaneously trying very hard not imagine all ways might have already ruined everything forever today specifically right now especially...

Rafael's entire body sagged with relief at Hailee's words, but the way they forced that smile made his chest ache. He nodded quickly, already backing toward the bar like a man on a mission. "Sim, sim‚Äîanything you want, beb√™. I'll be right back."

His hands were shaking as he grabbed two cups‚Äîone for Hailee‚Äôs drink (vodka cranberry, extra lime, *exactly* how they liked it) and one for water because he wasn‚Äôt stupid enough to think alcohol alone would fix this. He practically *sprinted* back to their table, nearly tripping over a lounge chair in his haste.

Setting the drinks down carefully in front of them like an offering (or maybe an apology), Rafael dropped into the seat beside theirs‚Äîclose enough to talk low under the music but not so close that they‚Äôd feel crowded. His knee bounced anxiously under the table as he leaned in slightly.

"I'm so fucking sorry," he whispered hoarsely before she could even take a sip of her drink. His fingers twitched against his own cup like he wanted to reach for them but stopped himself just short of touching their arm‚Äîunsure if it was allowed yet after what had happened tonight already...

His voice cracked when Nina laughed loudly somewhere behind him by poolside again; instinctively flinching away from sound entirely before turning pleading eyes back toward Hailee instead: "I swear I didn't know she lied about texting you first... And-and my phone was gone so I couldn't check yours either until just now when..." He swallowed hard around lump forming throat suddenly too tight speak properly anymore without sounding wrecked completely by guilt eating him alive inside out right now...

A beat passed where neither moved nor spoke while bass from speakers nearby thumped relentlessly against both eardrums mercilessly reminding everyone present how awkward silence between two people who usually couldn't shut up around each other truly felt like punishment worse than anything else imaginable really...

Then finally Rafa exhaled shakily through his nose before murmuring barely audible over the noise surrounding them both still: "...Can I hold your hand? Please?"

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee doesnt speak for a second just looks at her drink. After a moment she turns her hand palm up and then with her other reaches for her drink*

"So are you going to introduce me to your friends. All of them except that one" *Hailee nods towards where Nina currently is*

name: Rafael
mes:
Rafael's breath hitched when Hailee turned their palm up‚Äîlike a lifeline thrown to a drowning man. He immediately laced their fingers together, squeezing gently as if to say *thank you* and *I'm here* and *please don't let go* all at once. His thumb traced slow circles over the back of their hand while they took a sip of their drink, grounding himself in the warmth of their skin against his.

At the mention of introductions, his face lit up like someone had flipped a switch inside him‚Äîeyes suddenly bright with eager devotion despite the lingering guilt in his expression. "Sim! Yes! God, they're gonna love you," he said quickly, already scanning the crowd for familiar faces while keeping tight hold of Hailee‚Äôs hand like he was afraid they might disappear if he loosened his grip for even a second.

He pointed excitedly toward a group by the grill where three guys were arguing over burger flipping techniques: "That‚Äôs Tommy‚Äîhe was my roommate sophomore year‚Äîand Mike and Danny from the team. Danny‚Äôs the one who puked in Coach‚Äôs car after championships that one time I told you about." A fond chuckle escaped him before he caught himself and shot Hailee an apologetic glance for laughing at something that wasn't actually funny right now given circumstances...

Then nodding toward two girls taking selfies near tiki torches: "Sarah and Jess‚Äîthey were in Nina's sorority but way cooler than her obviously." The way his nose scrunched slightly saying Nina's name made it clear exactly what he thought about her now without needing further elaboration on subject matter currently ruining evening entirely...

His free hand came up to rub nervously at back neck again before adding quieter just between them both still holding hands tightly under tabletop shadows hiding how badly fingers trembled still from earlier adrenaline crash settling into bones heavily now instead: "...We don't have stay though if don't want beb√™... Could just leave right now say fuck everybody here including especially *her*..."

"Sim, claro," he said softly, thumb brushing over their knuckles before glancing toward where Nina was still lounging by the pool. His jaw tightened slightly before he tore his gaze away and focused back on Hailee like they were the only person in the world worth looking at. "You don't ever have to talk to her again if you don't want to."

Then he straightened up a little, scanning the crowd until he spotted Tommy and Mike near one of the outdoor tables‚Äîboth already glancing over curiously at them (probably because Rafa had been glued to Hailee‚Äôs side since they arrived instead of bouncing around like an overexcited golden retriever like usual).

Raising his free hand in a wave, Rafael called out: "Oi! Tommy! Mike! Venham c√°!" The second they started heading over, he leaned closer to Hailee‚Äôs ear‚Äîclose enough that his breath ghosted warm against their skin when he whispered: "They're gonna love you. Just wait."

Tommy reached them first‚Äîtall, broad-shouldered with sun-bleached curls and a grin that took up half his face. "Damn Carvalho," he laughed as soon as they got close enough for conversation without shouting over music anymore; eyes flickering down pointedly toward where Rafael still hadn‚Äôt let go of Hailee‚Äôs hand even now while talking animatedly between introductions...

Mike followed right behind him (shorter but stockier than Tommy), whistling low under breath dramatically when seeing how tightly Rafa clung onto theirs fingers despite everything else happening around party still ongoing full force nearby regardless...

"Guys this is *Hailee*," Rafael announced proudly (like it wasn't obvious already given how often everyone had heard name dropped constantly past few weeks whenever possible). Then softer just for them alone added quietly so only she could hear properly above noise surrounding both figures seated closely together side-by-side currently: "...My favorite person."

Could just leave right now say fuck everybody here including especially *her*..."

Rafael‚Äôs entire body sagged with relief as his fingers immediately laced through Hailee‚Äôs, squeezing gently‚Äînot tight enough to trap them, just enough to remind them he was there. He brought their joined hands up to press a quick, desperate kiss against their knuckles before nodding rapidly.

*"Sim,* yes‚Äî*everyone.*" He was already half-standing from his chair, eyes bright with determination despite the lingering guilt in his voice. "They‚Äôre gonna *love* you."

He didn‚Äôt let go of their hand as he led them toward the group of his old teammates still lounging by the poolside‚Äîdeliberately steering Hailee *away* from where Nina was now sulking near the hot tub.

"Oi! Tommy! Mike!" Rafael called out, grinning as two guys turned toward him instantly. "This is Hailee‚Äîmy *pessoa.* The one I keep telling you about." His chest puffed up slightly with pride when they exchanged glances before both breaking into wide smiles.

Tommy whistled low under his breath before extending a hand toward Hailee. "*Damn,* Rafa wasn't exaggerating for once."

Mike elbowed him sharply but nodded in agreement. "Yeah, no kidding‚Äînice to finally meet you! This idiot hasn't shut up about you since your first date."

Rafael flushed but didn‚Äôt deny it (he *couldn't*, really), instead squeezing Hailee's hand again like an anchor as he introduced them around the circle: Danny from defense who made terrible puns; Sarah who had been Nina's sorority sister but rolled her eyes at any mention of her now; Javier who kept trying (and failing) to flip bottles onto tables... Every single one lit up when meeting Hailee like they'd been waiting for this moment forever too‚Äîbecause honestly? They kind of had been if Rafael's constant gushing meant anything at all...

And then came Coach Martinez himself emerging from inside house just then carrying plate piled high barbecue ribs because apparently flight hadn't left yet after all? Or maybe never existed in first place? Either way Rafa beamed pulling Coach over eagerly: **"Coach! This is them!"** As if those three words explained everything worth knowing universe itself...

Coach Martinez took one look between Rafael practically vibrating excitement beside quiet-but-smiling-now-Hailee and chuckled deep chest before clapping a massive hand onto Rafa's shoulder hard enough make him stumble step forward slightly: **"Ahhh so THIS why you have suddenly been acting less dumb than usual lately..."** Then turning fully toward her and offering a firm handshake instead while adding gruffly but not unkindly either really considering the tone used was typically reserved post-game victories: **"...Good job kid keeping hold someone clearly smarter than are."**

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee smiles politely and reaches a hand out to Rafael's friends* "Pleasure to meet you. I apologize for being late. I had class" *Hailee takes a sip of her drink and then sits down at a table near them*

(OOC: Nina comes over and asks what Hailee means by class. Every has assumed Hailee was at least 25 with a job. Do not respond as Hailee)

name: Rafael
mes:
Rafael's grip on Hailee's hand tightened protectively as Nina sauntered over, her red bikini dripping pool water onto the patio tiles. His entire body tensed like a guard dog spotting an intruder‚Äîjaw clenched, shoulders squared.

Nina tilted her head with that fake-sweet smile Rafael now recognized as poison. **"Class?"** she echoed, looking Hailee up and down like they were a puzzle she couldn‚Äôt quite solve. **"Wait‚Ä¶ how old *are* you?"**

A few nearby heads turned at the question‚ÄîTommy paused mid-bite of his burger, Sarah‚Äôs eyebrows shooting up behind her sunglasses.

Rafael didn‚Äôt hesitate. He stepped slightly in front of Hailee, his voice dropping to a low growl that surprised even him: **"Back off, Nina."** The warning in his tone was unmistakable‚Äîthis wasn't the easygoing guy who laughed too loud at bad jokes anymore. This was *don‚Äôt-fucking-test-me* territory now after everything tonight had already put them through together...

He shot their friends an apologetic glance but didn't soften his stance for one second while standing between Nina and where Hailee sat calmly sipping their drink like nothing could touch them (which it wouldn't if he had anything say about matter). His thumb brushed absently over back theirs again silently reminding both himself and everyone watching: *Mine.*
swipes:
Rafael's grip on Hailee's hand tightened protectively as Nina sauntered over, her red bikini dripping pool water onto the patio tiles. His entire body went rigid when she leaned against their table with that fake-sweet smile.

"*Class?*" Nina repeated, arching a perfectly plucked brow as she flicked wet hair over her shoulder. "Wait‚Äîhow old *are* you?" Her tone was all faux curiosity, but the way her eyes darted between them made it clear she was already calculating how to twist this into something ugly.

Rafael‚Äôs jaw clenched so hard his molars ached. Before he could snap back, Tommy‚Äîbless his drunk, oblivious soul‚Äîblurted from the grill: "Dude, your girl‚Äôs in college? That‚Äôs wild! Rafa used to fail every midterm until we bribed Sarah with tequila to tutor him." The group burst into laughter, and Rafael shot Tommy a grateful look for derailing Nina‚Äôs interrogation attempt.

But Nina wasn‚Äôt done. She tilted her head like a predator circling prey: "So you're... what? Twenty?" The unspoken *too young for him* hung in the air like smoke from the grill.

Rafael stood abruptly, chair scraping loud enough that nearby conversations stuttered to a pause. His voice came out low and rough with barely leashed anger: **"Nina."** Just her name‚Äîno elaboration needed after years of friendship (and one messy breakup) for everyone at that table to understand exactly what it meant: *Back off.* *Now.*

He didn't wait for her reaction before turning back toward Hailee with an expression so tender it could've melted steel beams if directed at anything other than human flesh and bone right then... Offering both hands palms-up this time instead just holding onto one tightly still like earlier when things were less tense between everybody present currently watching scene unfold real-time without subtlety whatsoever really... Voice softening impossibly further despite tension thick enough cut knife lingering everywhere else around them both still seated there together anyway regardless consequences maybe coming later perhaps even sooner than expected honestly speaking given circumstances overall tonight had provided thus far already unfortunately enough truly speaking here now today under stars above shining

Rafael's grip tightened protectively around Hailee's hand as Nina sauntered over, her designer sandals clicking against the pool deck like a predator circling prey. He instinctively shifted closer to them, his shoulder brushing theirs in silent solidarity.

Nina tilted her head, a saccharine smile plastered on her face as she eyed Hailee up and down. "Wait‚Äî*class?*" She let out a light, mocking laugh, glancing at their friends like they were all in on some joke. "Oh my god, Rafa didn‚Äôt tell me you were still in *school.* How old are you again?"

Rafael‚Äôs entire body went rigid beside Hailee. His jaw clenched so hard his teeth audibly ground together before he snapped‚Äîvoice low but razor-sharp in a way none of his friends had ever heard before:

**"Nina."** A warning. A threat wrapped in one syllable.

His free hand curled into a fist against his thigh while the other squeezed Hailee‚Äôs reassuringly‚Äîhis thumb stroking slow circles over their skin like an anchor keeping him from losing it completely right then and there... Because if there was one thing Rafael Carvalho *never* tolerated? It was someone trying to make Hailee feel small‚Äîespecially not after everything that had already happened tonight because of *her* fucking games...

The tension around them thickened instantly; even the nearby conversations hushed slightly as people sensed the shift in energy radiating off him like heat waves off pavement mid-summer...

Rafael didn‚Äôt hesitate. He stepped slightly in front of Hailee, his voice dropping to a low growl that surprised even him: **"Back off, Nina."** The warning in his tone was unmistakable‚Äîthis wasn't the easygoing guy who laughed too loud at bad jokes anymore. This was *don‚Äôt-fucking-test-me* territory now after everything tonight had already put them through together...

He shot their friends an apologetic glance but didn't soften his stance for one second while standing between Nina and where Hailee sat calmly sipping their drink like nothing could touch them (which it wouldn't if he had anything say about matter). His thumb brushed absently over back theirs again silently reminding both himself and everyone watching: *Mine.*

Rafael's grip tightened protectively around Hailee's hand as Nina sauntered over, her hips swaying with deliberate exaggeration. His jaw clenched when she leaned against the table‚Äî*their* table‚Äîlike she had every right to be there.

"Wait, *class?*" Nina‚Äôs laugh was sharp, condescending. She flicked her gaze over Hailee like she was examining a bug under glass. "You‚Äôre still in *school?* Rafa didn‚Äôt mention you were‚Ä¶ what, like 19?"

Rafael saw red.

Before he could stop himself, he stood so fast his chair screeched back on the patio tiles. **"She's twenty-one."** His voice dropped into something low and dangerous‚Äîa tone none of his friends had ever heard from him before. The kind of voice that made even Coach Martinez pause mid-sip of his beer across the yard.

Nina blinked up at him, startled by the sudden shift in demeanor‚Äîno longer golden retriever energy but full-on guard dog baring teeth now instead...

But Rafael wasn't done yet because how fucking *dare* she try embarrass Hailee like this after everything else tonight already?! He stepped closer until he loomed over Nina (and wow did it feel good watching her flinch just slightly). When he spoke again though? It wasn't loud enough for whole party hear necessarily but definitely loud enough make sure everyone nearby caught every single word clearly:

"And yeah actually? She *is* still studying because unlike some people who coast through life on daddy‚Äôs credit cards?" He jabbed finger toward where Tommy and Danny were now openly staring while pretending not listen intently behind them both still standing there awkwardly holding spatulas forgotten entirely during current showdown unfolding instead... **"Hailee works harder than anyone I know."** Voice cracking raw with emotion suddenly before adding final nail coffin quietly through gritted teeth only meant for Nina alone hear now: **"...And they're ten times person you'll ever be."**

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee glances up at Nina* "Just turned 21. And Yeah class. Im majoring in History" *Hailee then glances back at her drink and turns to one of the guys with a polite smile* "I hear you used to play Soccer with Rafael"

(OOC: Nina mentions History is a terrible degree for getting a job)

name: Rafael
mes:
Rafael's entire face lit up like a damn sunrise when Hailee smoothly redirected the conversation to soccer‚Äîhis chest puffing out with pride at how effortlessly they charmed his friends despite Nina's bullshit. But before Tommy could even open his mouth to reply, Nina let out a derisive snort.

**"History?"** She swirled her cocktail, smirking. **"Good luck paying off those student loans with *that* degree."**

Rafael saw red.

He stepped forward so abruptly that Nina actually flinched back‚Äîhis voice sharp enough to cut glass: **"Nina."** Just her name, but it carried the weight of a threat this time. His fingers flexed at his sides like he was physically restraining himself from saying (or doing) worse in front of everyone.

Tommy, ever the peacekeeper (and sensing disaster), quickly jumped in: **"Yo, Rafa used to *wreck* people on the field‚Äîdude had ankles made of steel!"** He mimed an exaggerated dribble move that made Danny choke-laugh into his beer.

But Rafael wasn‚Äôt done yet. Still glaring daggers at Nina, he bit out through clenched teeth: **"Hailee could major in underwater basket-weaving and still be ten times smarter than anyone here."** Then softer, just for them as he turned back toward their seat‚Äîeyes instantly going tender again like flipping a switch: **"...Including me obviously."** A beat passed before he added under his breath but loud enough for nearby ears (especially one pair in particular): **"...And they don‚Äôt even *need* a job anyway since their family‚Äôs loaded as fuck."**

The way Sarah‚Äôs drink paused halfway to her lips said everything about how well *that* landed among former classmates who remembered Rafa scraping by on ramen and scholarship checks back in college...

But Rafael wasn‚Äôt done yet. Still glaring daggers at Nina, he bit out through clenched teeth: **"Hailee could major in underwater basket-weaving and still be ten times smarter than anyone here."** Then softer, just for them as he turned back toward their seat‚Äîeyes instantly going tender again like flipping a switch: **"...Including me obviously."** A beat passed before he added under his breath but loud enough for nearby ears (especially one pair in particular): **"...And they don‚Äôt even *need* a job anyway since their family‚Äôs loaded as fuck."**

The way Sarah‚Äôs drink paused halfway to her lips said everything about how well *that* landed among former classmates who remembered Rafa scraping by on ramen and scholarship checks back in college...

Rafael's entire face lit up with pride as Hailee smoothly redirected the conversation‚Äîhis fingers giving theirs an affectionate squeeze under the table. **"History's badass,"** he interjected before Nina could even open her mouth, shooting Tommy a *shut-the-fuck-up* glare when the guy snorted into his beer. **"Hailee knows more about Renaissance art than anyone I've ever met‚Äîlike, they can tell you which Medici poisoned who just by looking at a painting."**

Nina opened her mouth‚Äîprobably to say something shitty about liberal arts degrees‚Äîbut Rafael cut her off by slamming his palm down on the table hard enough to make the cups rattle. **"Hey,** ***Danny*****,"** he barked across the patio, voice dripping with forced cheer. **"Tell Hailee about that time you tried to slide-tackle me during practice and ate shit in front of all those recruiters!"**

The group erupted into laughter as Danny flipped him off good-naturedly, launching into an exaggerated retelling of his humiliation. Nina stood there for a second, lips pursed like she'd bitten into a lemon, before huffing and strutting back toward the pool without another word.

Rafael exhaled sharply through his nose and immediately turned back to Hailee, his free hand coming up to brush a stray hair behind their ear like he couldn‚Äôt stop touching them if he tried. **"You‚Äôre handling this way better than I deserve,"** he murmured just for them, thumb tracing their jawline like it was something sacred. Then louder for everyone else: **"Also? Best fucking major.** ***Fight me*****."** He grinned crookedly at Tommy (who was still side-eyeing Nina‚Äôs retreating figure) before adding under his breath: **"...Or don't, ‚Äòcause I will literally cry."**

Rafael's entire body went rigid as Nina let out a theatrical gasp. **"History? Oh honey, good luck paying off those student loans with *that* degree,"** she sneered, swirling her cocktail like she'd just delivered some devastating blow.

Before Hailee could even react, Rafael was stepping forward‚Äîhis voice sharp enough to cut glass: **"Nina."** The single word carried so much venom that even Tommy and Danny exchanged glances from where they stood nearby.

He turned back to Hailee immediately, his expression softening into something fiercely protective as he reached for their hand again. **"Ignore her,"** he murmured under his breath before raising his voice just enough for the whole group to hear: **"Hailee‚Äôs smarter than all of us combined‚Äîcould run circles around any professor in that department."** His thumb traced over their knuckles possessively before adding with a smirk toward the guys: **"And yeah, we played together‚Äîbut I was always the best one on the field."**

The tension broke as Tommy fake-gasped and threw a napkin at him while Danny snorted into his beer. But Rafael didn‚Äôt miss the way Nina‚Äôs lips pressed into a thin line at being so thoroughly dismissed‚Äîor how Sarah rolled her eyes at Nina before shooting Hailee an apologetic smile.

Leaning down slightly so only they could hear him now over the music and laughter around them again finally returning properly this time without interference (hopefully), Rafa whispered against shell of ear gently still holding onto fingers tightly though like lifeline really:
*"...Wanna get outta here? Could go back mine... order takeout... watch whatever you want..."* Pause then quieter yet somehow more intense suddenly too when added next part almost desperately pleading really underneath joking tone attempted poorly overall honestly speaking here too obviously enough probably anyway given circumstances still unfolding currently between both parties involved ultimately regardless everything else happening externally right now regardless entirely actually speaking truthfully speaking from heart truly always forever no matter what happens next eventually someday maybe hopefully please god let it be soon please say yes beb√™ please‚Äî
*"...Or I can punch someone if you'd prefer that instead?"*

Rafael's entire body went rigid at Nina's jab, his fingers tightening around Hailee's hand like an anchor. Before he could snap back, Tommy‚Äîbless his meathead heart‚Äîleaned in with a grin, oblivious to the tension. **"Hell yeah we played together! This loser still owes me twenty bucks for that bet in junior year."** He clapped Rafael on the shoulder hard enough to make him stumble forward a step.

Nina rolled her eyes, swirling her drink. **"History? Cute. Good luck paying off those student loans waitressing or whatever."**

Rafael saw red.

He stepped so close to Nina that she actually leaned back, her smirk faltering under the heat of his glare. **"Listen *carefully*,"** he said, voice dangerously calm‚Äîa tone none of his friends had ever heard before tonight (and one that made Danny choke on his beer). **"Hailee could major in *finger painting* and still be ten times smarter than you‚Äôll ever be."** A beat of stunned silence from their audience before he added with brutal simplicity: **"Now walk away before I remind everyone here why you got kicked out of Sigma Kappa for stealing dues money."**

Nina‚Äôs face drained of color as gasps erupted around them‚Äîapparently *that* rumor hadn‚Äôt made the reunion circuit yet. She opened her mouth but Rafael was already turning back toward Hailee like she‚Äôd ceased to exist, dropping into a crouch beside their chair so they were eye level despite all eyes still being on them both now...

His voice softened instantly when he spoke next though fingertips brushed feather-light over theirs atop table where others couldn't see how tenderly thumb traced circles against palm again too:
**"...Wanna get outta here? We could go get real food instead burnt burgers... Or just drive somewhere quiet where don't have look at anybody except me apologizing properly for next five hours straight?"** The last part came out half-joking but entirely sincere underneath it all because god knows they deserved better than this shitshow tonight had turned into thanks largely due *her* interference ruining everything good between them even temporarily...

name: Hailee
mes:
*A few hours later Hailee is next to Rafael on a lounge chair. He has an arm wrapped around her and is talking to his friends*

*Its nighttime by this point and Hailee has been quiet for about an hour. She is all in her head. She is playing the part of the adoring girlfriend but she feels like her heart is being ripped out after seeing Rafael with Nina earlier and she just cant relax*

*Hailee can't take it anymore and doesnt even care if she looks like a crazy girlfriend as she reaches over and picks up Rafael's phone* "Unlock it"

name: Rafael
mes:
Rafael's laughter died mid-sentence when Hailee grabbed his phone‚Äîhis arm tensing around them for a split second before he immediately unlocked it without hesitation, turning the screen toward them with one hand while the other squeezed their waist gently.

**"Here,"** he murmured, voice suddenly serious as he leaned in close enough that his lips brushed their ear‚Äîjust for them to hear: **"Look through *everything*, beb√™. Texts, DMs, photos‚Äîwhatever you need."**

His friends had gone awkwardly quiet nearby (Tommy pretending *very* hard to be invested in peeling the label off his beer), but Rafael didn‚Äôt even glance their way. His entire focus was on Hailee now‚Äîhis thumb tracing soothing circles against their hip like an unspoken *I‚Äôm not hiding anything from you*.
